thread.title: NBA trade rumors: Latest news, updates ahead of Thursday's trade deadline
thread.title_full: NBA trade rumors: Latest news, updates ahead of Thursday's trade deadline

author: Jordan Greer (jgreer@sportingnews.com)
title: NBA trade rumors: Latest news, updates ahead of Thursday's trade deadline
text:
February 22, 2017 10:19am   10:19am EST NBA trade season is upon us. Sporting News will keep you up to date with the latest news and rumors ahead of Thursday's 3 p.m. deadline. Bulls guard Jimmy Butler   10:19 a.m. ET 
Updated at 10:19 a.m. ET 
Brace yourselves — it's NBA trade season. 
The first major domino fell late Sunday night when the Kings sent DeMarcus Cousins to the Pelicans for ... yeah, sorry Kings fans. So, who else will be moving ahead of Thursday's 3 p.m. trade deadline? 
MORE: These draft pick protections could make major impact on NBA futures 
Big names like Paul George, Derrick Rose and Andre Drummond were being thrown out in trade talks on Tuesday. It's still a lot of chatter at this point, but teams could get antsy in the hopes of dramatically altering their futures. 
Sporting News will make sure you know the latest trade news and rumors. Follow along for the latest updates below. Latest NBA trade rumors, news, updates 
10:15 a.m. — Trade talks between the Bulls and Celtics regarding Jimmy Butler aren't smoke and mirrors, according to TNT and NBA.com reporter David Aldridge. Here's what Aldridge had to say on NBA TV (via Brian Robb of CelticsHub ): 
"(The Celtics) have been trying to get Jimmy Butler. (Danny Ainge) doesn't want to give up Jae Crowder. That's the main sticking point here, and he doesn't want to give up Jae Crowder in a deal, and that's the guy the Bulls are insisting on right now in any package for Butler ... Chicago, I think rightly, is saying, 'If you want our best player, we're not going to just do it for picks. We're not going to take guys you aren't going to keep on your roster. We want a guy that is going to be able to grow with us, along with one of those high picks.' They want a top half of the lottery type pick for Jimmy Butler, along with a starting established player under contract. I understand that from Chicago's point of view." Watch This
